lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How are you doing today?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been feeling really anxious for the past month. I can't relax no matter what I do.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Can you tell me more about what the anxiety feels like?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My heart races, I get sweaty palms, and there's tightness in my chest. I feel like something terrible is about to happen.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you had any panic attacks?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Two weeks ago at the grocery store my heart was pounding, I couldn't breathe, and I felt dizzy.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How is this affecting your daily life?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been avoiding going out. I called in sick to work three times last week.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: How has your sleep been?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I lie in bed for hours worrying. When I fall asleep I wake up at 3 or 4 AM.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Is there anything specific causing you stress?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: My mom was diagnosed with cancer two months ago. I'm trying to help care for her while working full time.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any changes in eating habits?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I barely eat. I've lost about 8 pounds in the last month.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Are you using any substances to cope?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: More wine at night, maybe a bottle every couple of days. And lots of coffee.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Have you been treated for anxiety or depression before?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I was on Lexapro about five years ago for depression. Stopped after a year.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any thoughts of hurting yourself?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: No, nothing like that. Just overwhelmed and exhausted.
